alert.note: Alert for Crawford; Lawrence (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 01 at 10:14AM CST until January 10 at 4:31PM CST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana... East Fork White River at Seymour. White River at Petersburg. White River at Newberry. White River at Edwardsport. White River at Elliston. White River at Hazleton. Wabash River at Clinton. Wabash River at Riverton. Wabash River at Hutsonville Legacy Power Plant Site. Wabash River at Terre Haute. Wabash River at Montezuma. Wabash River at Covington. Wabash River at Lafayette. .Rainfall earlier this week has resulted in minor flooding along Wabash...White and East Fork White rivers. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING THROUGH MONDAY, JANUARY 10... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wabash River at Riverton. * WHEN...Until Monday, January 10. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Extensive lowland flooding is in progress. High water surrounds many river cabins. Access to most river cabins is by boat only. Levees begin to protect farmland. Extensive flooding of Leaverton Park occurs in Palestine, Illinois. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM CST Saturday /11:00 AM EST Saturday/ the stage was 17.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:00 AM CST Saturday /11:00 AM EST Saturday/ was 17.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 18.2 feet early Wednesday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage Monday, January 10. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. The next statement should be issued this evening by around 1115 PM EST /1015 PM CST/.
